Class AdderFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • AdderFilter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Chainable, Filter

    public class AdderFilter
extends java.lang.Object
implements Filter, Chainable
    The AdderFilter adds points from its two inputs and produces a DataStream object containing the sums.

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AdderFilter()
      Constructs an AdderFilter.

      DataStream requestData()

    • Method Detail

      • apply

        public void apply()
        Applies the filter's operation. Adds the values from two inputs' equivalent indices and appends each sum to the output stream.
        Specified by:
        apply in interface Filter

      • connectInput

        public void connectInput(Chainable input)
        Do not use. AdderFilter requires two inputs. WILL throw exception.
        Specified by:
        connectInput in interface Chainable
        Parameters:
        input - do not use

      • connectInput

        public void connectInput(Chainable in1,
                         Chainable in2)
        Connects the two addend input Chainable objects.
        Specified by:
        connectInput in interface Chainable
        Parameters:
        in1 - addend 1 object
        in2 - addend 2 object

      • requestData

        public DataStream requestData()
        Gets the data from filter's inputs, and once received, calls its apply() method.
        Specified by:
        requestData in interface Chainable
        Returns:
        output of the filter operation
